Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • Grid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Grid class is the main class for the game. It supports all the features and properties of the game. It contains the players, the balls, media players, stacks that are required for the functioning of the game.
    Author:
    Meet Arora
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        private Grid(int n,
             int m,
             javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid,
             Player[] players,
             GamePage gamePage)
        Constructor using values of number of rows, number of columns, the GridPane, and the Players array. It also stores the reference to the GamePage object.
        Parameters:
        n - is the number of rows
        m - is the number of columns
        grid - is the GridPane which will be used for the layout
        players - is the array of Players playing the game
        gamePage - is the GamePage object

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        static Grid getInstance(int n,
                        int m,
                        javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid,
                        Player[] players,
                        GamePage gamePage)
        Making the Grid class as singleton.
        Parameters:
        n - is the number of rows
        m - is the number of columns
        grid - is the GridPane which will be used for the layout
        players - is the array of Players playing the game
        gamePage - is the GamePage object
        Returns:
        the sole Grid instance of the class

      • resetInstance

        static void resetInstance()
        Reset the object so that a new game doesn't have an old instance.

      • isNotEnded

        boolean isNotEnded()
        Returns a boolean value signifying whether the game has ended or not.
        Returns:
        true if the game has not ended and false otherwise

      • getFlag

        int getFlag()
        Gets the flag value which signifies whether the first move has been made.
        Returns:
        flag which is an integer signifying the first move of the game

      • setComputerMode

        void setComputerMode()
        Sets the computer mode if selected which happens when a single player wants to play.

      • getSoundMode

        int getSoundMode()
        Gets soundMode which is 1 when sounds are playing and 0 when not.
        Returns:
        soundMode which is an integer representing whether sounds are muted or not

      • toggleSoundMode

        void toggleSoundMode()
        Toggles sound mode. Turns on sound mode if off and vice-versa.

      • serializeMatrix

        void serializeMatrix()
        Turns the grid matrix into a serializable version so that the state of the game can be saved.

      • makeNode

        private void makeNode(int i,
                      int j,
                      Ball[][] matrix)
        Makes visual nodes ie balls on the grid using the values of row index, column index provided and using the grid which specifies the properties of the nodes at the given indices.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        matrix - is the grid of balls containing the properties of the cells

      • resolve

        void resolve(javafx.scene.layout.GridPane grid,
             GamePage game)
        Fills up the GridPane with the appropriate state of the saved game on resuming. It then serves as the layout for the scene of the game page.
        Parameters:
        grid - is the GridPane which will serve as the layout for the game page
        game - is the reference to the GamePage object

      • removeGridNodes

        private void removeGridNodes()
        Removes all the nodes from the visual grid so that no nodes from a previous version of the grid can be seen during the current game.

      • returnPrevPlayer

        private int returnPrevPlayer()
        Returns the index of the previous player that has not lost yet.
        Returns:
        index of the previous player

      • restartGame

        void restartGame()
        Restarts the game by resetting all the values.

      • undo

        void undo()
        Sets the grid matrix to a previous state and thus performing an undo. This would only work if there is indeed a previous state to go to as well as the player has undo moves left.

      • saveState

        private void saveState()
        Saves the previous state of the grid in a stack so undo moves can be performed.

      • makeUnclickable

        private void makeUnclickable()
        Makes all those cells and nodes within those cells have the 'default' mouse cursor on hover that belong to a different player.

      • makeClickable

        private void makeClickable()
        Makes all the cells and nodes withing those cells that are valid for the current player have the 'click' mouse cursor on hover.

      • hasPlayerLost

        private boolean hasPlayerLost(int flag,
                              int curr_player)
        Returns a boolean signifying whether the player has lost ie the player does not have any balls left on the grid. If flag is 1, the function call has been made from the prevPlayer function and so no update to the player's hasLost value should be made because the player cannot lose on undo.
        Parameters:
        flag - is an integer value that specifies where the call was made from
        curr_player - is an integer value that specifies the index of the player
        Returns:
        true if the player has lost and false otherwise

      • prevPlayer

        private void prevPlayer()
        Passes the turn to a previous player on undo.

      • nextPlayer

        private void nextPlayer()
        Passes the turn to the next player once the current player has finished their turn.

      • playerLose

        private void playerLose()
        Checks if any player has lost in the previous turn. If yes, clears the stack so that undo cannot be done.

      • checkValidity

        boolean checkValidity(int i,
                      int j)
        Returns a boolean signifying where the cell selected is a valid position for the current player to select.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        Returns:
        true if the position is valid and false otherwise

      • checkWin

        private boolean checkWin()
        Returns a boolean value signifying whether the current player has won the game by determining if all the balls on the grid belong to the current player.
        Returns:
        true if the current player has won and false otherwise

      • noAnimation

        boolean noAnimation()
        Returns a boolean value signifying whether any of the specified animations are in progress.
        Returns:
        true if at least one of the specified animations is playing and false otherwise

      • isGameOver

        private void isGameOver()
        Checks whether the game is over. If it is, displays the winner and provides with further options the user can select. If not, continues with the game.

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(int i,
                 int j)
        Sets a current player's node at the selected position only after ensuring that the position is valid.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the selected cell
        j - is the column index of the selected cell

      • getMass

        private int getMass(int i,
                    int j)
        Gets the mass in the specified cell. If the specified cell has no mass ie there is no ball in the cell, creates a new ball and puts it in the cell before returning the mass.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        Returns:
        the mass in the cell

      • makeCircle

        private void makeCircle(javafx.scene.shape.Circle s,
                        int i,
                        int j,
                        javafx.scene.paint.Color color)
        Makes the visual balls that are to placed in the grid at the given row index and column index. Also sets the appropriate properties for the ball including the provided color.
        Parameters:
        s - is the Circle that represents the visual of the ball
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        color - is the Color that is filled in the ball

      • rotateTwo

        private void rotateTwo(int i,
                       int j,
                       Ball[][] matrix)
        Provides the two-ball animation to the nodes in the cell that is specified by the row index, column index, and the ball matrix provided.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        matrix - is the grid of balls in which the specified cell belongs

      • rotateThree

        private void rotateThree(int i,
                         int j,
                         Ball[][] matrix)
        Provides the three-ball animation to the nodes in the cell that is specified by the row index, column index, and the ball matrix provided.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        matrix - is the grid of balls in which the specified cell belongs

      • rotateCorner

        private void rotateCorner(int i,
                          int j,
                          Ball[][] matrix)
        Provides the corner-ball animation to the nodes in the cell that is specified by the row index, column index, and the ball matrix provided.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        matrix - is the grid of balls in which the specified cell belongs

      • isCorner

        boolean isCorner(int i,
                 int j)
        Checks whether the cell specified by the row index and the column index is at a corner of the grid.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        Returns:
        true if the cell is at a corner and false otherwise

      • isExtremeSide

        boolean isExtremeSide(int i,
                      int j)
        Checks whether the cell specified by the row index and the column index lies on an extreme side of the grid.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
        Returns:
        true if the cell is on an extreme side of the grid

      • setMass

        private void setMass(int i,
                     int j)
        Increases mass of the cell that is present at the row index and the column index provided. It then places a visual representation of the node at the designated cell.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell

      • checkMass

        private void checkMass(int i,
                       int j)
        Checks mass of the nodes present at the cell specified by the row index and the column index provided. If the mass exceeds the limit of the cell, sends the cell to be burst.
        Parameters:
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell

      • burst

        private void burst(int val,
                   int i,
                   int j)
        Bursts the nodes in the cell specified by the row index and the column index provided. Before that, it adds the splitting-animation to the nodes based on the mass value and the position of the cell.
        Parameters:
        val - is the mass value of the node in the cell
        i - is the row index of the cell
        j - is the column index of the cell
